Question:
Select the best type of model for each use case, matching the use case to the options provided:

\noindent
Use cases:
\begin{enumerate}[label=\alph*.]
    \item[1.]
    Tumor segmentation analysis or recognizing tumor patches in medical ``slides''.
    \item[2.]
    Sentiment analysis on a large text corpus.
    \item[3.]
    Time series forecasting to predict price of automobile in the next month.
    \item[4.]
    Predict the price of a house based on square feet, ratio of bedrooms/bathrooms.
\end{enumerate}

\noindent
Options: CNN, RNN, Fully connected neural network
Solution: (1) CNN, (2) RNN, (3) RNN, (4) Fully connected neural network.
ChatGPTSolution:
Use cases and best type of model:

Tumor segmentation analysis or recognizing tumor patches in medical "slides": CNN
Sentiment analysis on a large text corpus: Fully connected neural network
Time series forecasting to predict price of automobile in the next month: RNN
Predict the price of a house based on square feet, ratio of bedrooms/bathrooms: Fully connected neural network
FewShotAnswer:
, Transformer

\noindent
1. CNN
2. RNN
3. Fully connected neural network
4. Transformer

\noindent
CNNs are good at image analysis, RNNs are good at text analysis, fully connected neural networks are good at tabular data, and Transformers are good at text analysis.
